model

Class FootballPredictionModel

  • java.lang.Object
    • model.FootballPredictionModel
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    PredictionModel

    public class FootballPredictionModel
extends java.lang.Object
implements PredictionModel
    This class is used to predict game events for football from given probabilities and football. Each instance of a FootballPredictionModel represents a market whose data is getting the prediction algorithm applied
    Author:
    Craig

      • getFavouredRunner

        public java.lang.String getFavouredRunner()
        Specified by:
        getFavouredRunner in interface PredictionModel
        Returns:
        null if the PredictionModel doesn't represent the given market. It gives the runner name with the highest initial probability if the market name matches the internal market name.

      • closeMarket

        public void closeMarket()
        Description copied from interface: PredictionModel
        Mark the market that the PredictionModel observes as closed. One more possible prediction event will be produced by it, depending on if the market closing relates to an event (e.g. for football: penalty market shuts when a penalty occurs)
        Specified by:
        closeMarket in interface PredictionModel
